quote: Actions follow being.
author: Aristotle

quote: Life is growth. You grow or you die.
author: Phil Knight

quote: Peace is happiness at rest and happiness is peace in motion.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Out of intense complexities, intense simplicities emerge.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Time is the currency of life.
author: Daniel Kahneman

quote: Do not cling to a mistake just because you spent a lot of time making it.
author: Kevin Kelly

quote: Resources are plentiful. Knowledge is scarce.
author: David Deutsch

quote: People with very high expectations have very low resilience.
author: Jensen Huang

quote: To disagree silently is disloyal.
author: Reed Hastings

quote: Feedback is a gift.
author: Tobi Lutke

quote: The future is already here--its just not evenly distributed.
author: William Gibson

quote: You can't think well without writing well, and you can't write well without reading well.
author: Paul Graham

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nun

quote: A problem well stated is half solved.
author: Charles Kettering

quote: Not wanting someting is as good as having it.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Procrastination is the soul rebelling against entrapment.
author: Nassim Taleb

quote: The complicated behavior of the world around us is merely 'surface complexity' arising out of deep simplicity.
author: John Gribbin

quote: Surprise is the measure of a poor hypothesis. A good model makes reality look normal, not weird.
author: Eliezer Yudkowsky

quote: Wisdom is the discarding of vices and the return to virtue, by way of knowledge.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Desire is a contract you make with yourself to be unhappy until you get what you want.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: If you want it done, then go. And if not, then send.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Mimicking the herd invites regression to the mean.
author: Charlie Munger

quote: All the returns in life, whether in wealth, relationships, or knowledge, come from compound interest.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Science is an awkward, disorganized, inefficient activity. It is simply more efficient than any other human activity.
author: Edwin Land

quote: An entrepreneur can't benefit from macro-scale insight unless his own plans begin at the micro-scale.
author: Peter Thiel

quote: Think of distribution as something essential to the design of your product.
author: Peter Thiel

quote: He not busy being born is busy dying.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: The only person who can cause you more harm than a thief with a dagger is a journalist with a pen.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Most of the world's knowledge is written somewhere--you just gotta read the right books.
author: Bill Ackman

quote: Victory awaits him who has everything in order--luck, people call it.
author: Roald Amundsen

quote: You're not advertising to a standing army. You're advertising to a moving parade.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: In the best establishments, promises are always kept, whatever it may cost in agony and overtime.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forwards.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: There is no middle ground; either don't throw any punches, or strike hard and end it quickly.
author: Peter Thiel

quote: Comfort is killing your dreams.
author: Chris Choi

quote: In the real world outside economic theory, every business is successful exactly to the extent that it does something others cannot.
author: Peter Thiel

quote: Whatever your views on thermodynamics, it's a powerful metaphor: in business, equilibruim means stasis, and stasis means death.
author: Peter Thiel

quote: The ones who are crazy enough to think that they can change the world are the ones who do.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Abstraction is key to conceptualizing the universe.
author: Grant Sanderson

quote: Who controls the past controls the future. Who controls the present controls the past.
author: George Orwell

quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
author: George Santayana

quote: I think the history of science has shown that valuable consequences often proliferate from simple curiosity.
author: Claude Shannon

quote: Life is never indifferent and never in balance. We are steadily overcoming our problems or they are steadily overcoming us.
author: Dee Hock

quote: No dream is so great as the person you might become by remaining true to it.
author: Dee Hock

quote: To speak is craft; to listen is art.
author: Dee Hock

quote: People are rewarded in public for what they practice for years in private.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: It's not just money that compounds. Knowledge and skills do too. Stop quitting!
author: Michael Bloomberg

quote: It is the doers; the lean and hungry ones, those with ambition in their eyes and fire in their bellies  who go the furthest and achieve the most.
author: Michael Bloomberg

quote: Influencing the future requires four ways of looking at things: as they were, as they are, as they might become, and as they ought to be.
author: Dee Hock

quote: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Differentiation is survival.
author: Jeff Bezos

quote: For a successful technology, reality must take precedence over public relations, for Nature cannot be fooled.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: Thinking small is a self fulfilling prophecy.
author: Jeff Bezos

quote: Competition is not only the life of trade, it is the trade of life.
author: Will & Ariel Durant

quote: Show me the incentive and I will show you the outcome.
author: Charlie Munger

quote: Most companies that innovate early keep innovating. The companies that innovate late actually never innovate again.
author: Elad Gil

quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

quote: Intelligence is a lever on the rest of the world in kind of a very fundamental way; to make a lot of things better at the same time.
author: Marc Andreessen

quote: The only good generic startup advice is that there's no good generic startup advice.
author: Elad Gil

quote: Talent density beats talent mass.
author: Dario Amodei

quote: From ancient Greece to modern Silicon Valley there's only one thing that brings civilizations, countries, and companies down, which is hubris.
author: Satya Nadella

quote: Risk-taking is the engine that moves humanity forward.
author: Brad Gerstner

quote: Being an entrepreneur is the art of the possible. You have to will things into existence.
author: Brad Gerstner

quote: What is the difference between a madman and a genius? Success.
author: Javier Milei

quote: Necessity is the mother of both technical and creative invention.
author: Gavin Baker

quote: The output of any company is the vector sum of the people within it.
author: Elon Musk

quote: Proof and observation are merely means by which we check our observations.
author: David Deutsch

quote: I would rather have questions that can't be answered than answers that can't be questioned.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: Suffering is intimately related to staticity.
author: David Deutsch

quote: Explanatory knowledge is the defining adaptation of our species.
author: David Deutsch

quote: Theories postulating anomalies without explaining them are less likely than their rivals to make true predictions.
author: David Deutsch

quote: The cure for a fallacious argument is a better argument, not the suppression of ideas.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Extraordinary claims require extraordinary proof.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Don't copy the what. Copy the how.
author: Kobe Bryant

quote: Every man has two lives, and the second starts when he realizes he has just one.
author: Confucius

quote: Pay attention to opportunity cost at all times; doing one thing means not doing other things. This is a form of risk that is very easy to ignore to your own detriment.
author: Marc Andreessen

quote: Focus is about saying no.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Vision without execution is just hallucination.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Good communication is the bridge between confusion and clarity.
author: Nat Turner

quote: He that is good with a hammer tends to think everything is a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: It's never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Thinking is diffifult, that's why most people judge.
author: Carl Jung

quote: We suffer more in our imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

quote: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: Economic growth is not a cure-all, but lack of growth is a kill-all.
author: Paul Collier

quote: If you don't know where you are going, every road will get you nowhere.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: There are two ways to be fooled. One is to believe what isn't true. The other is to refuse to accept what is true.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Perfecting oneself is as much unlearning as it is learning.
author: Edgar Dijkstra

quote: Time spent getting a thing right is never wasted; it is time saved in the end.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: There's a way to do it better - find it!
author: Thomas Edison

quote: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
author: Rumi

quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

quote: I skate to where the puck is going to be, not where it has been.
author: Wayne Gretzky

quote: Perspective: it is bad to have an opinion you're proud of if you can't state the arguments for the other side better than your opponents.
author: Charlie Munger

quote: Good ideas are rare--when the odds are greatly in your favor, bet heavily.
author: Charlie Munger

quote: I think of each hour spent on fitness as one day less that I’ll spend in a hospital.
author: Ed Thorp

quote: Though the institutions of society have difficulty learning from history, individuals can do so.
author: Ed Thorp

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: The first lesson of economics is scarcity: there is never enough of something to satisfy everyone. The first lesson of politics is to ignore the first lesson of economics.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
author: Socrates

quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: What if laziness is nothing but a habit of thinking about the effort instead of thinking about the outcome?
author: Scott Adams

quote: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: He who writes for fools always finds a large public. A precondition for reading good books is not reading bad ones: for life is short.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quote: Every truth passes through three stages before it is recognized. In the first stage it is ridiculed, in the second stage it is opposed, in the third stage it is regarded as self-evident.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Rationality is not about knowing facts, it's about recognizing which facts are relevant.
author: Grant Sanderson

quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Hypothesis are nets: only he who casts will catch.
author: Novalis

quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: You’re born, you have a set of sensory experiences, then you die, and how you choose to interpret those sensory inputs is up to you.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: We can move to better theories only if we take our best existing theories seriously, as explanations of the world.
author: David Deutsch

quote: No theory of knowledge should attempt to explain why we are successful in our attempt to explain things.
author: Karl Popper

quote: It is not for the benevolence of the butcher that we expect our daily meat. It is for his self interest.
author: Adam Smith

quote: The only people who achieve much are those who want knowledge so badly that they seek it while the conditions are unfavorable. Favorable conditions never come.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons of history.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Writing is not just communicating with others, but also with your own unconscious mind.
author: Gurwinder Bhogal

quote: How you do one thing is how you do all things.
author: David Senra

quote: The greatest risk in this day and age is to take no risks.
author: David Senra

quote: Big thinkers often do big things. Small thinkers never do big things
author: Don Valentine

quote: We must constantly remind ourselves as to why we are successful and what we must do to continue to be successful, because if we become complacent, brother it’s all over with.
author: Les Schwab

quote: Success breeds complacency. Complacency breeds failure. Only the paranoid survive.
author: Andy Grove

quote: Strategy is not words, strategy is action.
author: Jensen Huang

quote: You build a great company by doing things that other people can’t do. You don’t build a company by fighting other people to do things that everyone can do.
author: Jensen Huang

quote: The key to success on the internet is you want to be the biggest fish in the pond, but the success metric is not competing with other fish, it’s finding your own pond. The opportunity is broad, it’s not deep.
author: Ben Thompson

quote: The purpose of models is not to fit the data but to sharpen the questions.
author: Samuel Karlin

quote: The reality is that there is no objective reality, at least when it comes to who you are. Everything about yourself that you might care about only makes sense relative to the other features of the environment.
author: Kevin Simler

quote: Personality is a strategy for making the most of one's particular lot in life.
author: Kevin Simler

quote: Scientific revolutions are more often driven by new tools than by new concepts.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: A lot of people overestimate others' abilities to execute on simple ideas and give up on their complicated ideas (sunk cost fallacy). Even if something is obvious to do, surprisingly few people will do it.
author: Nathan Lambert

quote: More economic activity means you have more exposed surface area to have more discoveries.
author: Ege Erdil

quote: What makes things hard isn’t complexity, it’s consistency.
author: Alex Hormozi

quote: Losers fear rejection, winners fear regret.
author: Alex Hormozi
